title: Help required to Create Multiboot OS Disk

forumNotes.author: infinityusers
forumNotes.content:
Hi Team,  

I am trying to create a USB boot disk\[120GB HDD\]. I have XP,Win7,Linux and Solaris ISO images. but unable to create a boot disk with a menu where i can select a OS and it will install the same. Its very important for my day to day work. Appreciate any help regarding the same.  

Regards,  
infinityusers

Are you expecting that someone does your homework or are you wanting to learn how to do that? ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  

If the latter, start reading in the grub4dos forum:  
<http://reboot.pro/forum/66/>  
Particularly start reading these two:  
<http://reboot.pro/5041/>  
<http://reboot.pro/8944/>  

TO get an initial idea, then take some time around, you may be able to find links to:  
[http://sites.google....site/rmprepusb/](http://sites.google.com/site/rmprepusb/ "External link")  
and particularly to:  
[http://sites.google....-xp-from-an-iso](http://sites.google.com/site/rmprepusb/tutorials/install-xp-from-an-iso "External link")  
[http://sites.google....utorials/winiso](http://sites.google.com/site/rmprepusb/tutorials/winiso "External link")  
[http://sites.google....iskautounattend](http://sites.google.com/site/rmprepusb/tutorials/multiisoimdiskautounattend "External link")  

Linux is normally no problem.  

Solaris ***may*** . ![:unsure:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/unsure.png)  

![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  
Wonko
